<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"

 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".HomeActivity">

 style="@style/Text.Headline"

 app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent">

 android:layout_width="match_parent"

 app:cardCornerRadius="8dp"

 android:layout_width="match_parent"

 <androidx.appcompat.widget.AppCompatButton
 android:id="@+id/surprise_btn"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:text="Surprise"/>

 </LinearLayout>

 </androidx.cardview.widget.CardView>

 <androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView
 android:id="@+id/chapter_rv"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="0dp"
 android:layout_marginBottom="8dp"
 android:layout_weight="1"
 android:elevation="2dp"
 android:padding="12dp" />
</LinearLayout>

 <!-- Bottom Navigation CardView -->

 android:id="@+id/bottom_nav_card"

 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_margin="12dp"
 android:elevation="8dp"
 app:cardCornerRadius="24dp"
 app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"

 app:itemIconTint="@color/colorPrimaryVariant"

 </androidx.cardview.widget.CardView>
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>

I've found the issue. In your style.xml file, you have styles like `Text.Headline`, `Text.Body`, and `Text.Caption`, but there's no parent style defined simply as `Text`. 

Android resource linking is failing because the `Text.Headline` style in your layout is trying to inherit from a base `Text` style that doesn't exist.

You need to add a base `Text` style definition in your style.xml file. Here's how to fix it:

```xml:app/src/main/res/values/style.xml
<resources>
 <!-- Add this base Text style -->
 <style name="Text">
 <!-- Common text attributes can go here -->
 <item name="android:textColor">@color/colorTextPrimary</item>
```

I see we're having issues with the PowerShell terminal. Let me try a simpler approach with just a short, targeted explanation.

Based on my analysis, here's what's causing the bottom navigation bar to appear bloated:

1. The MaterialCardView wrapper around the BottomNavigationView is adding unnecessary padding and elevation.
2. The attributes like clipChildren and clipToPadding could be causing visual issues.

Here's what you need to do to fix it:

1. Replace the MaterialCardView wrapper with just the BottomNavigationView directly as a child of the ConstraintLayout.
2. Make sure the LinearLayout containing your main content constrains to the top of the BottomNavigationView instead of the parent bottom.
3. Set proper margins for the BottomNavigationView.

You should modify your activity_home.xml to look like this:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout xmlns:android="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res/android"
 xmlns:app="http://schemas.android.com/apk/res-auto"
 xmlns:tools="http://schemas.android.com/tools"
 android:id="@+id/main"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="match_parent"
 tools:context=".HomeActivity">

 <LinearLayout
 android:layout_width="0dp"
 android:layout_height="0dp"
 android:orientation="vertical"
 android:padding="8dp"
 app:layout_constraintBottom_toTopOf="@id/bottom_nav"
 app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintTop_toTopOf="parent">

 <!-- Your existing content -->
 <TextView
 android:id="@+id/app_name_txt"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 style="@style/Text.Headline"
 android:text="Just One Mark" />
 
 <!-- Other elements remain the same -->
 </LinearLayout>

 <!-- Direct BottomNavigationView without CardView wrapper -->
 <com.google.android.material.bottomnavigation.BottomNavigationView
 android:id="@+id/bottom_nav"
 android:layout_width="match_parent"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:layout_marginStart="4dp"
 android:layout_marginEnd="4dp"
 android:layout_marginBottom="4dp"
 android:background="@color/colorSurface"
 app:itemIconTint="@color/colorPrimaryVariant"
 app:itemTextColor="@color/colorPrimary"
 app:menu="@menu/bottom_nav_menu"
 app:elevation="4dp"
 app:layout_constraintBottom_toBottomOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintEnd_toEndOf="parent"
 app:layout_constraintStart_toStartOf="parent" />
</androidx.constraintlayout.widget.ConstraintLayout>
```

This removes the unnecessary wrapping CardView and makes the BottomNavigationView directly a child of the ConstraintLayout with proper constraints."}]},{"role":"user","content":[{"type":"text","text":"<user_query>

I'm still having technical issues with the file editing. Here's what you need to do to fix the tall bottom navigation bar:

1. Open your `app/src/main/res/values/style.xml` file and add this style at the end (before the closing `</resources>` tag):
```xml
<style name="BottomNavText" parent="TextAppearance.AppCompat.Caption">
 <item name="android:textSize">10sp</item>
 <item name="android:fontFamily">@font/nuget_regular</item>
</style>
```

2. Then open your `app/src/main/res/layout/activity_home.xml` file and change the BottomNavigationView inside the MaterialCardView as follows:
```xml
<com.google.android.material.bottomnavigation.BottomNavigationView
 android:id="@+id/bottom_nav"
 android:layout_width="wrap_content"
 android:layout_height="wrap_content"
 android:background="@color/colorSurface"
 app:itemIconTint="@color/colorPrimaryVariant"
 app:itemTextColor="@color/colorPrimary"
 app:menu="@menu/bottom_nav_menu"
 app:itemIconSize="24dp"
 app:labelVisibilityMode="labeled"
 app:itemTextAppearanceActive="@style/BottomNavText"
 app:itemTextAppearanceInactive="@style/BottomNavText"/>
```

These changes will:
- Reduce the text size in the navigation items
- Control the icon size
- Apply proper text styling to make the bottom navigation bar less tall"}]}]}
